result.execSummary:
Jessie James Sapp III was extradited to another county, state or jurisdiction. Extradition means Jessie James Sapp III was accused or convicted of an offense in another county, state or jurisdiction and was taken there to face their charge(s) or conviction.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jessie James Sapp III

records.addlTxt: Have to open with initial to close case.

9:36 AM Defendant Jessie James Sapp in court, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Jessie James Sapp.  Attorney David V. Meany in court for State of Wisconsin.  22CT32 and 22CF136.   22CF136 demand from state of Illinois for extradition, recv'd copy of compliant, waives rights, waives right to formal extradition, will go voluntarily.  Atty is satisfied.  Court is satisfied and accepts waiver.  Def the Waiver has a wrong name and mentioned that he is a third and that is not on the form.  Court can put on the record to amend name and COC will change.  Back on the record at 9:48.  Court amending the caption the caption on cases ordered to be amended to Jessie James Sapp lll.  All parties sign.  22CT32 Atty is not appointed, willing to take case though.  Atty would get permission to appear for 22CT32 and other pending case.
Extradition hearing on August 30, 2022 at 09:30 am.

8:33 AM Defendant Jessie James Sapp appeared by video, in custody from ACJ.  Attorney Ralph David Imholte appeared by video for Jessie James Sapp.  Attorney David V. Meany appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Extradition compliant has been filed, demand from state of Illinois for surrender on charges.  Def has received copy of compliant.  Court given rights, def understand rights.  Atty wondering if Wi cases will be dealt with prior, def is not contesting.  Court needs def present to go through with proceeding.  Def comments.  Court rescheduling, def states fine if Atty zooms.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant
